fields.description:
When adding a quick filter with "ORDER BY priority DESC, Rank ASC" I expect to get a quick-Filtered view that overrides the default "ranking" / ordering.

That seems currently not beeing supported but might be really helpful aside GHS-692
fields.summary: QuickFilters should be able to add ORDER BY contraint

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Upgrading JIRA Agile fails with a NullPointerException, Caught an exception trying to replicate reindexed issues.  The replicated index may or may not be correct.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Restore an instance with dodgy data.
# Attempt to upgrade it.

h3. Expected Results

The instance upgrades without any problems.

h3. Actual Results

The upgrade fails and the below exception and stack trace can be found in the logs:

h3. Workaround

This appears to fail due to orphaned custom field values that point to an issue that no longer exists. This can be identified with the below SQL:

{code:SQL}
SELECT * 
FROM   customfieldvalue 
WHERE  issue NOT IN (SELECT id 
                     FROM   jiraissue); 
{code}

And fixed with the following:

# Disable JIRA Agile.
# Stop JIRA.
# Backup the database.
# Execute the following:
{code:SQL}
DELETE FROM customfieldvalue 
WHERE  issue NOT IN (SELECT id 
                     FROM   jiraissue);
{code}
# Start JIRA, reindex and re-enable JIRA Agile.

fields.description:
When configuring JQL based swimlanes for a rapid board it would be useful to be able to specify JQL execution in a different order than swimlane order.

For example ({color:blue}not real, contrived to illustrate{color}):

{panel:title= Currently must do}

||Name||JQL||
|Critical|priority in (Critical, Blocker) and status != 'Waiting'|
|Queue|status != 'Waiting'|
|Waiting| |

To get issues to fall through to the Waiting swimlane additional criteria needs to be added to JQL for all higher swimlanes.
{panel}

{panel:title=Would like to do something like}

||Display Order||Name||JQL||
|3|Waiting|status = 'Waiting'|
|1|Critical|priority in (Critical, Blocker)|
|2|Queue| |

So the JQL for Waiting is executed first but displayed as the third swimlane down and the 'and status != 'Waiting'' stuff doesn't need to be duplicated on the other swimlanes.
{panel}

*Again, the example is contrived to illustrate.  I am aware that Waiting could be configured as a column.  I don't want to get into a discussion regarding proper use of columns vs swimlanes.*
fields.summary: Decouple JQL execution order from swimlane order

fields.description:

fields.summary: Issues on Plan Mode screen should not be limited to issues mapped to Columns, only by the board's Filter

fields.description:
According to the documentation on [Configuring Columns - Setting Column Constraints|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Configuring+Columns#ConfiguringColumns-Enablecolumncontraints]:

{quote}
Constraints specify how many issues a column can contain. You can specify constraints for all columns, or just some of them.

You can choose to exclude sub-tasks from the count. This is useful if you want to constrain the number of major tasks (stories) your team is working on, rather than the total number of individual tasks. This is likely to be more relevant to Scrum teams than to Kanban teams.
{quote}

Reading the docs, I believe the column *should* display only the maximum number set in the column constraint, but it doesn't (tested for both Scrum and Kanban). The only difference will be that column header now had a red line added:

!kanban.png!

!scrum.png!
fields.summary: Improve documentation for column constraints in JIRA Software (and JIRA Agile)

You can add existing issues to an active or future sprint, using the Plan mode of a board. Please note:

- adding an issue to an active sprint will be shown as a 'scope change' event on the Burndown Chart for that sprint.
- adding an issue to a sprint on one board will affect all other boards which contain that issue.

On another note, Creating a sprint, and moving the sprint markers is also disabled when not sorting by Rank, and I seem to remember that not being the case in earlier versions.  At this point, the Agile board is totally unusable if you are not sorting by Rank.

fields.description:
We have multiple boards with overlapping project filters; and sometimes it happens that an epic shows up on more than just one of the boards. Some epics contain issues of more than one of the projects (ex. a new feature in an integrated product requires a slight update in the backend, which also needs an update of the UI to allow it to be used).
Depending on whether the board shows all of the epics issues or not, the status indication (both the summary of Total/Completed issues and the small progress bar next to/below the epic name) shows the wrong result.
This caused us to close an epic that wasn't really done, which is not really helping in the longer term...

To reproduce, create two boards referencing two projects, with an epic referencing issues of both projects.
Board A references Project 1 and Project 2, with an Epic belonging to Project 1, having two issues belonging to Project 1 and Project 2 respectively.
Board B references only Project 1, and it shows the Epic.
When looking at Board A, the Epic has a Total Issue count of 2, with a status reflecting the actual issue state.
When looking at Board B, the Epic has a Total Issue count of 1.
If the issue from Project 1 was closed, Board B would show 100% completion on the epic; while Board A shows 50% completion.

We try to mark epics as complete as soon as they reach 100% in order to reduce their numbers; users/POs of Board B would close them early in cases where other projects are involved that arent shown on the Board.
fields.summary: Epic Progress does not include all issues; but only issues visible on the board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Creating a new Rapid Board appears to fail with the error message "The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.".

This is displayed in the attached screenshot.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Restore an instance with problematic data.
# Create a new board.

h3. Expected Results

The board is created without error.

h3. Actual Results

The board does not appear to be created and the red message is shown.

h3. Notes

This is caused by invalid entries in the user history - specifically references to non existing boards. This can be verified with the following SQL:

{code:SQL}
SELECT *
FROM   userhistoryitem
WHERE  username = 'admin'
       AND entitytype = 'RapidView'
       AND entityid::integer NOT IN (SELECT "ID"
                                     FROM   "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW");
{code}
(i) This is PostgreSQL-specific and may require changing for a different DBMS. Please consult with your DBA.

If this contains references to IDs that do not exist in the below output it is likely the problem described here is occurring:

h3. Workaround

This can be fixed by removing those entries:

# Stop JIRA.
# Backup the database using the native DB tools.
# Execute the following:
{code:SQL}
DELETE
FROM   userhistoryitem 
WHERE  username = 'admin' 
       AND entitytype = 'RapidView' 
       AND entityid::integer NOT IN (SELECT "ID"
                                     FROM   "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW");
{code}
(i) This is PostgreSQL-specific and may require changing for a different DBMS. Please consult with your DBA.
# Start JIRA and test the board creation.
fields.summary: Creating a new Board appears to fail with a message about it not existing or no permissions to view it

Hi,

The Stash developers have recently fixed their Application Links ([STASH-4502|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-4502]) to use the Display URL, not the Application URL.

This is very useful for those of us running user access via an Apache Proxy, but Application Links still via HTTP (because most Application Links are flakey at best over HTTPS)

When trying to link Confluence pages to Sprints, the normal page assignment functions work (so I've managed to link an existing Meeting Notes), however when I click "Create Page" it tries to redirect to the http url that isn't publically accessible. 

Could this button be changed, like Stash was, to use the Display URL instead of the Application URL?

Thanks,

fields.description:

There should be some sort of warning message if a column is added with no statuses in it.

So the bug is, it appears the sprint report is not getting story points from the current values in the tickets

At least in a tooltip! Those pages would be a LOT more useful if I didn't have to click on all of the tickets to see what they are. (Seems pretty basic to me!)

(I'm looking at the burn down chart, but I think it applies to others as well.)
fields.summary: Show ticket names on scrum board report tables

fields.description: I'd like to be able to filter the reports by the quick filters. The primary use case to be able to see burndown, etc. by developer, but I'm sure there are others.
fields.summary: Filter agile reports by quick filters

fields.description:
when i go to the Report tab of an Agile board, I choose Epic A as current Epic and scroll down via scroll bar to choose Epic B. but Epic B cannot be chose. The same issue to Sprint Report and others. But when i scroll via my mouse and choose the target, it works.
•	Click on the epic drop down
•	Using the scroll bar in the dropdown scroll to the end of the list and choose ‘Epic B’ – 3rd from bottom
•	It doesn’t work
fields.summary: Scroll Bar Does Not Work in IE10

fields.description: I need to be able to use filter by column and not just for the entire kanban.
fields.summary: Filter by Column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10563].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Clean install of JIRA 6.2.2 without JIRA Agile plugin installed
# The first time you log in, ensure that you do *not* have WebSudo (if you have it, "Drop access")
# Attempt to click the Agile item in the top navigation bar

h4. Expected

If you are authenticated with WebSudo, you should see the "Try JIRA Agile" dialog.

!with-websudo.png|thumbnail!

If you are not authenticated with WebSudo, you should see a dialog like "Create Project" shows you:

!without-websudo.png|thumbnail!

h4. Actual

Nothing happens

h3. Work around

Visit an administration page which requires WebSudo, then authenticate. Afterwards you should be able to successfully click the Agile menu item.
fields.summary: Agile link in Navigation header does not show "Try JIRA Agile" dialog

fields.description: Customer would like the option to have the clone button at the issue view detail in Agile board. Please refer to the screenshot for a more clear understanding.
fields.summary: Insert clone option in Agile Board details view

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour

Currently the board Administrator must create columns manually to adjust the status mapping. For enterprise customers with a lot of projects, boards, statuses and issues this can be very time consuming.

h3. Expected behaviour

We want a feature that would allow the user to enable automatic column creation based on the status. If I have 10 status for that board, and I want it to automatically map those statuses in their respective created columns. This will reduce time invested in board configuration for companies that need to perform this process very often.
fields.summary: As a user I would like agile boards to automatically generate columns based on statuses/project workflows.

fields.description:
When viewing an epic in Agile Plan mode, please add a "Create sub-task in epic" function similar to the current "Create issue in epic" function (see attachment).

Currently, when adding a sub-task directly to an Epic, it takes an extra four steps to create a sub-task for an Epic compared to creating an issue within an Epic.
fields.summary: Add "Create sub-task in epic" in Plan Mode Epic View

fields.description:
Issue with Agile Sprint Health Gadget for a Scrum board (having multiple projects). However It works okay if I select a specific project.

It was working fine until yesterday, see attached screenshot for error details.
fields.summary: Issue with Agile Sprint Health Gadget for a Scrum board

fields.description: The user wants the Epic Name to be clickable on the Issue detail page and be directed to the Epic itself. Right now, the epic name is not clickable and there's no way of being directed to the Epic itself from the Issue detail page. It is so much easier and more flexible if you can click on the Epic name.
fields.summary: Epic Name Clickable on the issue detail view

fields.description: JIRA is not sending emails when issues are created and when I enter @user.  The Notifications have not been changed.
fields.summary: Jira OnDemand stopped sending out emails on Friday

fields.description: At the current moment, it is not possible to downgrade the JIRA Agile plugin without restoring older data. So, to ensure that user can always roll back using the most recent data, prompt administrator to backup JIRA data before the plugin upgrade.
fields.summary: Prompt JIRA Administrator to Backup JIRA database before upgrading JIRA Agile Plugin

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# install JIRA 5.x or above
# add the Agile Wallboard Gadget into the Dashboard. Ensure that the Refresh Interval is set to Never as shown in screenshot AgileWallboardGadget.png
(i) Expectation, it will never refresh unless the user refresh the browser or the gadget manually. 
# (BUG) the behaviour observed is that, the gadget seems to be flicking and in the Developer Tool's Network tab we can see there are request thrown within a minute different. Refer to screenshot NetworkTab.png

This is tested in Incognito mode and browser without any extension installed.
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget is refreshing itself every minute even with the Refresh Interval set to Never
Cloned issues inherit the Completed Sprint value and can't be removed

fields.description: typo?
fields.summary: Minimumum

fields.description:
It would be great to have the ability to create one-off filters using JQL in the search box for the plan view as opposed to creating 'Quick filters' which does not scale too well when the number of filter becomes 10+. Also often times the quick filters my not used daily or often enough to justify being always available and accessible.

There is often the need to narrow down the issues by some search filter (e.g. what to see items assigned to a certain component, then another, then another).

The fact that the search box only filters by ticket summary is sort of misleading today since the great majority of the JIRA Agile users are also well versed with JIRA and using JQL.
fields.summary: Add ability to create one-off queries by JQL in the search box as opposed to creating 'Quick filters'

fields.description:
If a ranking operation fails at the database level (when Active Objects attempt to persist it into the database) it's possible that the instance can get into a state where duplicate log entries exist. This appears to cause ranking to stop updating and means JIRA needs to be restarted to fix the problem.

Whilst this workaround can work OK for smaller companies it affects Enterprise organisations significantly. Can you please enhance JIRA Agile to more gracefully handle this in-product so it doesn't need a workaround?

The workaround is covered in full detail in [How To Fix Issue Ranking Operation log entry found where none expected|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/How+To+Fix+Issue+Ranking+Operation+log+entry+found+where+none+expected].
fields.summary: As an admin I want JIRA Agile to recover more gracefully from database transaction errors

fields.description:
As a scrum team member, 
I want to be able to see the counts for each of the Work mode column's
So that I can get a quick glance of how many are in each state as well as how many of the total for that state are associated with my quick filters. 

NOTE: This used to work.  If I set column constraints but didn't put in any numbers, then it would display. However, now, it no longer does.
fields.summary: Column counts

fields.description: It should be possible to change default values like planEpicsVisible or planVersionsVisible.
fields.summary: Specify default boardSettings

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour

Currently it is possible to set a miniature/avatar for a project, that doesn't show up in the Agile board.

h3. Expected behaviour

We want the ability to set a logo for the Agile board or to share the project logo in the board (in case the board is single-project based)
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want the ability to use logos in Agile Boards

fields.description:
Here is the scenario - I entered story with 4 sub task in a sprint. 
In the sprint I could complete only 2 subtasks. Now I want to account for the completed efforts in the current sprint and move incomplete subtask and also incomplete part of story to next sprint. 
As there is no intelligent option users clone the story and make necessary updates. 
I would rather prefer to have intelligent split functionality
fields.summary: Is there a feature to split story?

fields.description: It's not easy to see to which project an epic belongs when you have a common Agile board for a number of projects, having the project icon next to the epic would help to indentify the project
fields.summary: As a project manager dealing with multipe projects I would like to see the icons of the projects in the epic panel

h3. Workaround:

Make sure every assignee of the issues in the Sprint backlog used by the Sprint Health Gadget use an uploaded avatar (JIRA avatar or custom avatar) and are not using the automatic letter based Avatars.
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget breaks after upgrade to 6.3.11

fields.description:
Customer Feedback
{quote}
The new initial added in GH 6.3.11 will cause us more trouble.  We would need to have either the real Initial (first 2 letters of full name?), or a different color for each first letter.

Example we have Martin and Michel they are both the same color in the board.

Thanks

Martin Poirier
Ubisoft Montreal
{quote}

It would be interesting to have the ability to select a specific color for the First Initial avatar.
fields.summary: Users would like the ability to change the First Initial Avatar color however they like

fields.description:
{{As an Agile board user I would like to hide the days in column on the cards}}

When the "days in column" dots are not required they can be distracting and/or waste screen estate. In some cases they can affect board performance.

h3. COS
* Add a board configuration option in the "columns" section.
* For kanban boards, this feature should ON by default, and for scrum it should be OFF by default.
* Body class / style for sprint support should be updated.

The toggle should allow scrum users to use this feature.

h3. Testing notes:

* Wallboard modes for scrum and kanban boards need to look correct. 
* Consider cards when:
** Estimate badges are there and days in column are.
** Estimate badges are not there and days in column are.
** Estimate badges are there and days in column are not
** Estimate badges are not there and days in column are not
** Test the same on non-wallboard work mode.
* Test cards with long summaries.

h3. Notes

(!) Disabling this functionality will *only* alleviate the performance impact of the JIRA Agile functionality that use the 'days in column'  functionality. It will not alleviate the entire performance problems caused by GHS-9611.

For example threads that can be seen in the below thread dump will perform better if this functionality is disabled, the threads use the {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.list.RapidIssueEntryQueryServiceImpl.loadDaysInColumn}} method which is known to cause performance problems.

fields.summary: Make 'days in column' visualisation on the cards optional

fields.description:
I run a project with multiple teams, each team has its own sprint.

When I go to 'Complete Sprint' I need the option to be able to send any work that was NOT completed during that sprint to the next sprint for that team, as opposed to returning to the backlog.

Now that sprints are first class citizens in JIRA I'm guessing this should be an easy change.

I'm coming from using the Classic boards - where Releasing a sprint gave the option to 'Move' options that were not 'Done', which is the workflow I require (using Sprints as opposed to Versions!)
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master running multiple sprints, I need to be able to release one sprint in to another, not in to the backlog
Editing a subtask removes its sprint value

fields.description:
How to reproduce:
1. Bulk edit some issues
2. At step 3 (operation details) type some junk into the Epic Link field and select the checkbox to the left
3. scroll to the bottom and click next
4. this should fail and an error at the epic link field should say that what you entered is invalid
5. make the epic link field empty and keep the check box to the left checked and scroll to the bottom and click next

fields.description:
Original summary: {{Need a way to distinguish between new tickets and previously prioritized tickets}}

Because of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6905, it's now very difficult to keep the Backlog prioritized.  People implicitly prioritize their tickets inadvertently by adding them into the middle of the backlog.

For my team, it's important to have a distinction between a Backlog, which is prioritized, and a list of new bugs which have not yet been prioritized.

I'd like to suggest adding a new group separate from the backlog, where all new tickets go.  It could be called something along the lines of "Needs Triage" or similar to indicate that these bugs have not yet been prioritized.  New bugs would go into this grouping, until they get prioritized in the backlog.
fields.summary: Distinguish new issues and previously prioritized issues

fields.description:
There is no easy way at the moment to see the size of the backlog in story points, and progress towards it from a project perspective.

The velocity charts in the Reports tabs are nice, but since we release at the end of each sprint, and have to use the Version field to store the release number, we can't use the velocity charts to show a picture of the whole project.

I'd like to see either:
* Another option on the Version Report to show "All" - i.e a single burnup chart regardless of version
* An additional tab on "Reports" that says "Projects" and allows you to see the burnup for an individual project, or multiple projects (i.e. the ability to multi-select from the list of projects that are included in your filter)

Note that this is distinct from GHS-5513, which relates to sprint level burnup charts (although many of the comments there are complaining of a lack of a project level view)
fields.summary: As a Product Owner, I want to see a burnup chart for the Project (not sprint or version)

For example, I have these tickets:

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Go to _Agile > Manage Board_ and create a new board.
# Create a new Scrum Board select "New project and a new board".
# Put board name as "Parent Issue" and project name as "ViewOnBoard".
# board filter will be:
{code} project = ViewOnBoard ORDER BY Rank ASC {code}
# Create 3 new issues with its sub-task.
# Go back to _Agile > Manage Board_ and copy the "Parent Issue" board.
# Then, create another scrum board called "Child Issues" and select "Existing Project" choose the "ViewOnBoard" project.
# After the board is created, go to _Board > Configure Board_.
# In general tab, edit the filter query to the below query and save.
{code} project = ViewOnBoard AND issuetype = Sub-task ORDER BY Rank ASC {code}
# Choose one of the sub-tasks and click the "View on Board".

*Expected Result:*
The board name should be listed in "Go To Board" window.

*Actual Result:*
Only the board for the parent issue is listed even though the sub-task is displayed in "Work" board.
fields.summary: Board Name for Sub-Task not showing on View on Board/Go To Board window.

fields.description:
Creating issues in JIRA sets ranking inconsistently.

h4. Steps to Replicate the Problem:
* Creating an Issue from a view other than the Planning Board (e.g. from the dashboard) causes the issue to appear at the bottom of the Planning View.
* When creating it from the Planning View, the new ticket will automatically appear underneath whichever ticket is currently selected.
* If no ticket is selected in the Planning View and a new ticket is added, that ticket will appear at the TOP of the backlog. To reproduce, just manually remove the {{selectedIssue=XXX}} query string parameter from the Planning View URL and try to create a new ticket.

h4. Expected Behavior:
Creating a new issue should put it to the bottom of the backlog at all times, to prevent accidentally giving the issue a priority.

Ref.: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/198381/configuring-new-issue-planning-board-position
fields.summary: "Create Issue" Sets Rank Randomly
